fieldDefinitions.metadataFormatVersion: Version of the metadata schema used
fieldDefinitions.headline: Title of the work
fieldDefinitions.author: Author name
fieldDefinitions.datePublished: Date of publication in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD)
fieldDefinitions.keywords: Tags and concepts associated with the work; INCLUDE the phase
fieldDefinitions.url: Canonical URL of the Substack post
fieldDefinitions.timeFelt: Phase context with timestamp and phase name
fieldDefinitions.whyItMatters: Why this piece matters in your larger Bloom
fieldDefinitions.sourceFragments: Quoted lines/notes that anchor the piece
fieldDefinitions.associatedMedia: Array of media objects with description and optional contentUrl
fieldDefinitions.generatedBy: Tool and date that generated this metadata

headline: The Turtle and the Tide
description: Ink-dense seascape where a turtle stands against the push of patterns and currents. A totemic emergence from the subconscious—what the ocean brings to shore.
author: Aleksandr Agnitio
resonantThread: Emergent Totems; Ocean motifs; Ousia Bloom phases
whyItMatters: Totem Current marks the surfacing of archetypes with minimal translation. The turtle becomes a carrier of endurance and shelter while the tide delivers the world’s noise—showing how forms rise intact from the deep.

motifMap.meaning: Forces of change; the world’s incoming data
Consecrated space; protected clarity amid chaos
Memory shards and signals washing ashore

articleExcerpt: A turtle faces the tide—the world’s noise rushes in, but the totem holds.

sourceFragments.note: Title as dyad: endurance vs. force

associatedMedia.description: Ink drawing with dense oceanic linework; central turtle outlined in yellow with cyan interior field.
